quote: One is never wounded by the love one gives, only by the love one expects.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The slope contains many wonders not found at the summit.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Philosophers console themselves with explanations.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The search for first causes is the ultimate wild goose chase.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you separate thought from life, you get philosophy.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Logical positivism is philosophy from the neck up.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The questions philosophers ask are not so much meaningless as irrelevant.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No explanation is ever as good as not having one.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The truth is what you live through while you're looking for the truth.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Never confuse a hunger for knowledge with a thirst for truth.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If words are the truth, what is living for?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What is true today may be false tomorrow, and true again the day after tomorrow.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Truth is a bubble and hard to hold on to.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Children, like God, see only our actions.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: In a godless universe, all we have is each other.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What kind of god would create a world in which the means of survival depends on our eating each other?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Wisdom is not making life any harder than it has to be.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Wisdom is knowing when you have enough.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I don't want to be the one who says life is beautiful. I want to be the one who feels it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness never made anyone rich or famous. That must be why ambitious people avoid it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If you think happiness is a rare bird you won't see much of it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nothing succeeds like indifference to success.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Enjoy the rainbow while it lasts and don't chase it when it's gone.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness: the feeling of being alive.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness is what matters, feeling alive-not art or knowledge or money.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness is my drug of choice.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be kind. Be happy. Be free.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Life said to me, Be happy. Don't let me down.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Life only wants us to be happy. We impose these burdens on ourselves.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Seekers, what are you seeking? Why aren't you happy just to be alive?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art is good, but happiness is better.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Days that lift us like a wave, when you feel you could live forever.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The optimist's hope and the pessimist's despair: reciprocal illusions.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We're all drowning, but don't say it out loud.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Everything but a life can be replaced.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When death speaks to me, it speaks only of the beauty of life.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One death apiece is plenty.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The first kiss and the first glass of wine are the best.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Emotion is the poetry of life.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Poetry is nothing if it exists only in books. One has to find it in one's own life.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: More sailors have drowned in words than in the sea.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be a poet in action as well as in words.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The deep roots never doubt spring will come.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: My faith likes mountains just where they are.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Writing is talking to yourself-with the hope of being overheard.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Writing is like life: it goes on.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A basket of ripe fruit is holier than any prayer book.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Whatever we may be or not be to others, to ourselves we are always just ourselves.
author: Marty Rubin
category: identity, labels, nationality, race, religion, stereotypes, the-self

quote: It takes a long time to learn how to do something simple.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Information is what you put in empty heads to keep them empty.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Knowledge is just a foundation. The whole point of a foundation is to build on it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What should be boundless is one's love of life, not one's love of art or knowledge.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When Socrates said he knew nothing he still thought he knew more than anyone else.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What do I know about life? What does a windmill know about the wind?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The more diseases you know about the sicker you are.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Too much success spoils success.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Success in love is mostly luck, though we hate to admit.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We let life down: it doesn't let us down.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Success in politics is the art of the timely lie.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The question must be asked: have we been the beneficiaries or the victims of our education?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The real plague is willful ignorance and education can't cure that.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: My education taught me a lot, but nothing I needed to learn.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Higher education-I wonder how much longer the deception can go on.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art should be pretentious. The place to be sincere is in one's relationships.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Sorrow's children were raised on books.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The spiritual life to me has always meant just one thing: feeling.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The mouse that fears the trap has already been trapped.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Who do I love? I love people who are easy to talk to.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The thread connecting one person, one event, to another exists only in the imagination.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What's wrong with people is people. There's no cure for that.
author: Marty Rubin
category: envy, greed, hate, humanity, misanthropy, people

quote: Build your castle of dreams but don't live in it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The Big Dream shattered splinters into a thousand little dreams.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Cities get built out of poet's dreams.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The rain that falls wherever it pleases. I want to be that rain.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Freedom began on the day the first sheep wandered away from the herd.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The wild ivy grows wherever it pleases.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art is a space in which freedom tests its wings.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Drink freely the wine life offers you and don't worry how much you spill.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To know your soul is your own, that's what counts.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When a thing becomes indispensable it's time to give it up.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The scientist seeks laws; the historian, causes; the artist, freedom.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Artists, by their free expressions, encourage others to be free. This is the quality that makes works of art enduring.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I never reach those far-off places. New trails tempt me at every turn.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A long leash is not freedom.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you love someone, really love them, you don't put chains on them. You want them to be free.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One is free, and at the mercy of everything.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be independent, and do what you will.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be independent, ad do what you will.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You don't have to live by someone else's rules. Do what you want. Be free.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I had no goals, no ambitions. That left me free to wander and amuse myself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You are free to create your own way of being. There are no rules.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: People on foot, on bikes, in cars, on planes-all chasing freedom.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What do we free spirits want? We just want to think our own thoughts and feel our own feelings. Why should that be a problem for anyone else?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Everything about sex and freedom interests me.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What is eternal is the cloud drifting slowly out of sight.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is no "the way things are." Every day is different, and you live it differently.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You can't judge the present by the past. Each day is different, and you live it differently.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You can't prepare for the things that change your life. They come suddenly and unannounced.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What would beauty be if the whole world were blind?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You can spit on a rose, but it's still a rose.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The beauty of this day doesn't depend on its lasting forever.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Order is what exists before you start arranging things.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I'd trade a hundred pretty faces for one person who's easy to talk to.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No one is more beautiful to me than a person who's easy to talk to.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Beauty is everywhere you look, but you have to look.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: How can you love art, beauty, poetry, and hate life? That's like saying you love the ocean but hate water.

category: art, beauty, hate, life, love, poetry

quote: A hundred lifetimes wouldn't suffice to see all the beauty in one acre of land.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We are given this beautiful life, this beautiful world, and we destroy it with ingratitude and hate.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The only valid rule for a work of art is that it be true to itself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art is a picture of the spirit.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art is the product of an imperfect world. In an ideal world, art would not exist.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Art is the product of an imperfect world. In a perfect world, art would not exist.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No art is harder to master than believing in yourself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A blackbird doesn't change its tune to suit the times.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A blank canvas is a playground for the imagination.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Parrots mimic their owners. Their owners consider that a sign of intelligence.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's a strange idea people have that thinking makes one intelligent.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Fine words have the power to make even the stupidest person sound intelligent.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Only kind people seem really human.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Frailty, thy name is human!
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We humans are like squirrels who spend all summer gathering and hoarding nuts and when winter comes can't remember where they are.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Let nothing human be considered sacred. Let nothing human be considered divine.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Beware of puny two-legged creatures claiming to be made in the image of God.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The technological revolution seems to have no higher purpose than to render humanity obsolete.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No work is so important you have to do it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: My feeling about work is that it's an unnecessary evil, so I've always done my best to avoid it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To avoid starvation is the only excuse for working.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If your work is stressful, it's not your work.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We need places to scream and run wild as well as places to be quiet.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The sight of a worm excites my reverence more than all the gods men have invented.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The true order is what the wind creates by scattering the leaves.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Even the faded flower denies nothingness.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There are 200,000 species of fly alone. So the void, the emptiness, must be in you.
author: Marty Rubin
category: attitude, emptiness, nature, nihilism, the-void, the-world

quote: Dance is the art closest to nature.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The snow in winter, the flowers in spring. There is no deeper reality.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nature is impulsive. To be impulsive is to be fully alive.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One should show one's scars, not hide them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Obsession is the evil genie who turns pleasure into pain.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The person with an itch can't understand why everyone's not scratching.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The pain you hide leaves the deepest scars.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is music you never hear unless you play it yourself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Music- a country one can inhabit only in music.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Music-a country one can inhabit only in music.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is music the moment you start listening.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The way to my heart is through your heart.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A heart grows flat and stale from too much thinking.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To keep a warm heart in a cold world is the real victory.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Where our attention goes, our mind and body go, too.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Movement is the freedom of the body; stillness, of the mind.

quote: If you can abuse your power you have too much.

quote: The seductive power of sex and money is nothing compared to that of words.

quote: To be saved is to believe in one's own courage.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One needs confidence in the morning and courage at night.

quote: You need fire, conviction, to write. You can't write out of indifference.

quote: What chance does logic have against a glass of wine and a kiss?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Real dishes break. That's how you know they're real.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The landscape looks different from every blade of grass.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Lies have always been easier to invent than reality.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We all live partially in reality and partially in a world of make-believe.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All our prayers can't keep a single leaf from falling.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: This may not be the best of all possible worlds, but it's the only real one.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Logic can't explain the salmon swimming upstream. So it denies the existence of salmon.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: In spring, the snow must go; in fall, the leaves can't stay.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Expectations have no effect on the harvest.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is no deeper reality. The water at the bottom is the same as the water at the top.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A cloud is more real than all my thoughts.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When people are facing real hardships in their lives, they have no time to invent imaginary ones.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What do I think? I think it makes no difference what I think.

quote: Every language has its own word for the sun, but the sun us always the same.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: In my mind I lead a phantom's life. My neighbor makes me real.

quote: Language is a ladder that always falls short of reality.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Lovers jump into bed without thinking. It's the only way it can be done.

quote: Love is the body's warmth; sex, its heat.

quote: A person can drop dead even while singing. But that's no reason to stop singing.

quote: One should dance while one still can.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The examined life: nothing is more futile or counterproductive. The active, joyous, spontaneous life: that is what one should aim for.

quote: My teachers told me: Question everything; take nothing for granted. I question nothing, I take everything for granted.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I don't travel to learn about the world. I travel for the joy of traveling.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Sing, laugh and be merry because today you're alive.

quote: There is a madness that is joy, and there is a madness that is just madness.

quote: One should never go dancing with a broken foot, but one should with a broken heart.

quote: In winter, on the darkest nights, one rejoices even to see the tiniest sliver of a moon.

quote: We owe it to the dead to dance on their graves.

quote: Blessed is the nightbird that sings for joy and not to be heard.

quote: A pessimist is someone who has forgotten the joy of beginning.

quote: Being alive is having what I want, that is my joy, my happiness.

quote: The child's naive dream of life is the only one worth having.

quote: All laughter is subversive, even the laughter of children.

quote: On the blank page all things are possible.

quote: Beautiful untrue things are even more beautiful when they're true.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All the great novels are about obsession and people who are obsessed.

quote: A story has to break your heart or it's not worth telling.

author: Marty Rubin

quote: Love is a wild child, always at odds with society.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We should not judge people or try to figure out what makes them tick. We should leave them the hell alone.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We shouldn't judge people or try to figure out what makes them tick. We should just leave them the hell alone.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No ideology or psychological theory can possibly do justice to the full range of human experience.

category: experience, humanity, ideology, philosophy, psychology, truth

quote: A chain grows weaker with each new link.

quote: When you stop seeing your weaknesses as weaknesses you will overcome them.

quote: We all suffer our share of grief but we are stronger than our grief.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's not the wound that teaches, but the healing.

quote: The unemotional life is not worth living.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I don't think about how to live my life. I just live it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When it comes to living and loving, we're all amateurs.

quote: What do I aspire to be? Just an ordinary person who values living.

quote: In the midst of a busy life don't forget to live.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The ripe apple falls, it doesn't know what else to do.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All creative work begins as play. The more one plays, the better one works.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Skepticism precludes one from believing many things, but not from loving many things.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One shouldn't be labelled a cynic just because one refuses to believe in fairy tales.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All belief is a form of voluntary madness.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I don't believe in love. I love.

quote: Never hold a belief longer than you can hold your breath.

quote: All the great stories are about obsession and people who are obsessed.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When your share your story with someone, it becomes their story too.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's the words we whisper to ourselves that make us who we are.

quote: Words make known. But we live in the unknown.

quote: In the dark, words get lost.

quote: A scent of lavender cannot be put into words.

quote: Words never change. What changes is how one interprets them.

quote: How long does one have to live before one can no longer be fooled by words?

quote: The world is so big and words are so small!

quote: Words can't save you, but they can give you courage.

quote: The profoundest thing writing teaches us is how much we contradict ourselves.

quote: The greatest obstacle to true learning is the inability to say "I don't know.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Experience is true, but not the lessons it teaches.

quote: What I learned from the flowers: to live effortlessly.

quote: After one has read everything and thought everything, one still have everything to learn.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One learns by doing, not by learning to do.

quote: What is love after all but trusting in the unknown.

quote: What is love after but trusting in the unknown.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Trust the one with experience, not the one with ideas.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Trust opens the door that pain had sealed shut.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Joy is wisdom I trust.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The man who doesn't howl at the moon when his mother dies is no man at all.

quote: Trees, O trees, why can't you hold on to your leaves?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Sing through your grief. Don't let your thoughts weigh you down.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Something or someone is always waving goodbye.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What is deeply felt is never lost.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Enjoy your life, the time you have now, because time cannot be found only lost.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Tears have always been easier to shed than explain.

quote: Unexpressed grief leaves the deepest scars.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A grief travels with us as far as we carry it.

quote: When you're young, you long for things that don't exist; and when you're old, you're sad because you never found them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A clean house is a sad house.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Practically all the sadness we experience in life comes from our feeling sorry for ourselves.

quote: Almost all sadness comes from feeling sorry for oneself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There are no sad days, only sad thoughts.

quote: What good is a song that doesn't break your heart?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nobody wants to be nothing. But that's the greatest thing in the world to be.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Imaginary diseases are the hardest to cure.

quote: How much of this day have you already forgotten?

quote: No one ever forgets a talk they had that lasted through the night.

quote: No one really remembers anything five minutes after it happens.

quote: It is better to err on the side of feeling.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Truly caring people know they have to take care of themselves first.

quote: Let a kind word warm you when your thoughts turn cold
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To keep a warm heart in winter is the real victory.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: My ideal journey: set out early and never arrive.

quote: You have to pay attention to the road even if you don't know where you're going.

quote: My greatest pleasure is to travel down an unfamiliar road.

quote: There are no safe voyages and no safe ports.

quote: The secret to being a good traveler is liking a place before you get there.

quote: When I told the rainbow what its colors meant, it laughed.

quote: We put ourselves through hell and that is hell.

quote: Love hurts because we think that's what love is.

quote: What is heroic is not making life any harder that it has to be.

quote: The flea that doubts doesn't jump nearly as high

quote: Self-doubt inflicts the deepest wounds.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The suicide? What would he have done if death did not exist?

quote: The suicide! What would he have done if death did not exist?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A brutal, relentless self-analysis lies at the heart of all despair.

quote: We usually fail at the things most important to us, precisely because they are so important to us.

quote: Thirst is a language even the grass understands.

quote: The person with an itch can't understand why everyone isn't scratching.

quote: People shouldn't question their desires. They should do what they want.

quote: Desires are only a problem when the means to fulfill them are not available.

quote: Delight in your sensuality, in the dance of your desires. Don't be ashamed of it.

quote: When people don't do what they want, they don't know what to do.

quote: My life is my book, but I can't read it.

quote: I like paths that lead nowhere, that leave you wondering where you are.

quote: Everybody calls me "Marty." I never know what to call myself.

quote: The tiniest mite has an inner life of which we can know nothing.

quote: Let the mystery carry you breathlessly along.

quote: My advice to you is to dance while you still can.

quote: Everyone I meet wants to give me directions, but I'm not lost.

quote: One should love oneself enough not to love oneself too much.

quote: Speak in your own voice about the things that matter to you.

quote: Even blind alleys lead somewhere.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Where the signposts end, the trail begins.

quote: Take a wrong turn. Get lost in something you love.

quote: Grace rides inside the waves.

quote: Words of the hero: "I am my fate.

quote: Meddling is the evil, not indifference.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There are no higher levels of consciousness, there are only different ways of perceiving things.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The world we see is beyond our understanding but not beyond our love.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If the cherry trees had to wait for understanding they'd never blossom.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you act without feeling, that's the living death.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's better to do things you like than to think about what you don't like.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It is better to do something you like than to think about what you don't like.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I don't try to explain or justify my actions. I simply do what I do.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Whatever you love, do it now. Time is not on your side.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One can be a pessimist in thought but not in action.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Thinking always deceives us when it becomes a substitute for action.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The test of our knowledge is not what we know, but what we can do.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The time you absolutely have to get off your ass and act is when action seems futile
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You can quarrel with a person's ideas, but not with their experience.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: One's duty is always and everywhere to be true to one's own experience.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Those who lack experience always have a lot of ideas.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Experience is not a means to realize the truth. Experience is the truth.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What doesn't kill us makes a good story.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If the sky falls, there'll be a bigger sky behind it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Where personal experience is concerned, we all speak a different language.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We feel more than we can express, we see more than we can say.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: How beautiful to touch another's soul with a word, a gesture, a thought.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Religion, culture, education are all things that sound wonderful in theory. In practice, however, they are not so wonderful.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I like dogs that bark a little. The silent ones scare me.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Better to find one thing to live for than a thousand things to be against.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Some thoughts are too angry to sleep. They lie awake all night and become obsessions.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Life is worth living but not worth thinking about.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is no condition so miserable that thinking can't make it worse.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The more one thinks, the less one sees.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Dead ends are where the real thinking begins.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Thinking is a way of condemning oneself to solitude.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: People don't think when they're enjoying themselves. Thinking is a sign of disturbance.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Thinking is a sign of disturbance. When your bladder doesn't hurt you don't think about it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To hate everything is to be wounded by everything.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Hate is only misdirected energy: it gets you nowhere.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Love is as irrational as hate and just as unpredictable.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All hate is the result of people refusing to take responsibility for their own lives.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Moral concepts are useful to the extent that they provoke opposition.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is no need to corrupt people's morals. Their morals have been corrupting them for years.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Morality is what the queen expects from the hive, not from herself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Morality is the clipping of a bird's wings.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The log on the fire: is it dreaming of the forest?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Every summer, like the roses, childhood returns.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Memories are never as true as the things one forgets.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You begin with other people's memories and end up with your own.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Never hesitate to tell the truth as you see it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The people who enlighten us are the ones who tell us their secrets.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Even the oldest trees aren't ashamed to stand naked.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Only lies are subtle. Truth walks right up to you in the street and kicks you in the ass.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: No burden is heavier to bear than the burden of a false idea.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Truth is an outlaw in every country.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A mask can hide you from others, but not from yourself.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Talking is good. It's good to disturb the silence.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Silence stands between the trees, waiting for the wind's roar.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Behind every mask there is a face, and behind that a story.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We are all nameless inside.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be what you are not. The true self is no one.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Any casual observer can tell at a glance I'm not the person I think I am.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Whatever we may be or seem to others, to ourselves we are always just ourselves
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What we invent, we become
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Distance is not a gulf but a bridge between lovers.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Distance is a bridge, not a gulf, between lovers.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: All lovers meet and love by chance.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A story has value whether it's true or not.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A scale can tell what a body weighs, but not its value.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The demand for justice always exceeds the supply.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Maybe there is no justice, just different degrees of injustice.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you transplant a rose, transplant the reddest one.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Being different is not a sin, but intolerance is.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A gloomy view of things is at least one misfortune you can avoid.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What makes or breaks us ultimately is our attitude toward the things we can't control.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A broken mirror is good luck if you want it to be.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The true poetic feeling is a feeling of boundless gratitude.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Be grateful to those who refuse your demands. They are your benefactors.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: oYu begin with other people's stories and end up with your own.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You begin with other people's stories and end up with your own.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The story of the tree is written on every leaf.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Some stories end in despair, some begin there
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Optimists think badly, but live well.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Because I took the sun for granted it shone on me.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Home is where you can go and rest and be nothing
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you are the problem, it's hard to see it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Walk slowly through the world and pay attention
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Death is not a choice, even for the suicide.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A man or woman becomes happy by choosing happiness every day.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The woods are full of poison berries but you don't have to eat them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The more idealism proves futile, the more I respect idealists.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We love those to whom we can tell our story.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Water flows because it's willing.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The great novels are deterrents. A Merck's manual on how not to live.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What saves us from succumbing to utter meaninglessness is not reason but instinct.

quote: The fish don't need to know why they're in the water.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The earth keeps turning but it never says why.
author: Marty Rubin
category: being, existence, explanations, life, reasons, the-world

quote: It felt so amazing to be alive I could never think of anything else.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Every leaf before it falls must think itself immortal.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Fire burns through thought.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When you enjoy a thought or activity, it's irrelevant whether it's meaningful or not.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Our thoughts deceive us more than our senses.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Life and love are never what you think they are.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is peace in knowing that whatever one thinks it is not the truth.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The earth and sky are like two mirrors facing each other.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Kisses are a shared solitude.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The person who knows how to enjoy their own company knows the most important thing.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: In solitude every fear, every longing, becomes exaggerated.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The wise oyster stays in its shell.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Don't try to create the world in your image-that was God's mistake.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You get up each morning and do what you can to survive. Nothing else is true, and nothing else matters.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We get up in the morning and do what we must to survive. Nothing else is true, and nothing else matters.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A blind man sees with his cane, like all the rest of us.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: What matters finally is how we feel about ourselves. After all, to a worm we're just food.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There are two kinds of love: the love that is and the love that isn't.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To sacrifice one's unhappiness for a good cause is something I fervently believe in.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness requires the ultimate sacrifice: to give up one's unhappiness.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Poets create gods, philosophers destroy them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The hammer never complains of the noise.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You say you are disappointed with life. But maybe it is life that' is disappointed with you.

quote: Self-consciousness is hell.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's during a storm that the best songs get written.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: A poem is an event, like a wedding or birth.

quote: Ideas stand in the corner and laugh while we fight over them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: It's better to develop hobbies and interests than to have ideas about things.

quote: A complicated idea is a confused idea.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Indifference to ideas is a sign of good health.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nothing is less like life than our idea of it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nihilism is a subject for comedy.

quote: Man is a problem-creating animal.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nothing is more seductive than nothing.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: When men set out to create order, they create only misery.

quote: Revenge is starting a fire you can't control.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Every human life has infinite value and to destroy even one is a crime against all humanity.

quote: Everyone dies young.

quote: The day you lose your sense of wonder is the day you grow old.

quote: Progress is discovering what you can do without.

quote: The only real progress in any activity is to love it more and more.

quote: The things that happen in the night are hidden even from the night.

quote: From one dog all the dogs bark.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We all talk to ourselves. Those we call mad just talk a little louder.

quote: The spiritual life to me has always meant just one thing: emotion. Emotion is the poetry of life.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The way to live well is to feel intensely.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The mind's best trick is the illusion that it exists.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The hardest secret to keep is one you don't know you have

quote: The unsaid rules every conversation.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Diseases aren't cured by giving them a name.

quote: The problem is not that we can't answer the great questions, but that we ask them in the first place.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Sometimes being indifferent solves everything.

quote: There are no simple solutions to imaginary problems.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The last goose in the column is flying just as high.

quote: Beware of that demon called 'Changing The World'.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Trying to be more than human one becomes less.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We are the mountains we must cross.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We waste this life dreaming of another.

quote: Calling the cat stupid never made the mice wise.

quote: How often have our own tears blinded us to the tears of others.

quote: In my travels I found no answers, only wonders.

quote: I like paths that lead to no certain end, that keep me wondering where I am.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The world is endlessly fascinating to those who take the time to look.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Artists must remain in a state of awe to remain artists.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: There is no end to wonder once one starts really looking.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I still find the moon more amazing than the fact men have walked on it.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To one who loves birds, morning always wakes up singing.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Every line is the perfect length if you don't measure it.

quote: To stay sane in a mad world is the real victory.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: To remain sane in a mad world is the true victory.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Open your eyes and breathe deeply. Wisdom is in the air.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Who gave fire permission to burn?
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I have no resentments, no complaints, no ax to grind. I simply feel what I feel and do what I do.

quote: The head follows the feet. We act first and find reasons later.

quote: The love of life begins with the love of one person.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We are fighting now to save that endangered species-the individual.

quote: You have to let the balloon go if you want to see it fly.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Seize the day, then let it go.

quote: It isn't drugs addicts have to give up. It's misery.

quote: Humor is the salvation of those without hope.

quote: The thought of death destroys some people and saves others.

quote: Struggle is less effective than doing nothing.

quote: A writer's tragedy: to know all the words and nothing else.

quote: The skies give no warning when they fall.

quote: What is is plenty, but more is never enough.

quote: We love to love and feel loved because love is the greatest pleasure of all.

quote: Pretending is one of our greatest pleasures. But you have to know you're pretending.

quote: May your wants be few and your pleasures many.

quote: Enjoying nonsense is one of life's primal pleasures.

quote: No one plants rosebushes for the thorns.

quote: Pleasure, like the sparrow, never sits on any one branch too long.

quote: An avalanche doesn't look back at the damage it causes.

quote: You don't love someone because it's the logical thing to do.

quote: Geniuses are a dime a dozen. The truly tolerant are rare.

quote: The real rain dance is when the rain dances.

quote: Music is the most abstract of the arts; dance, the most concrete.

quote: Intuition: the feeling you know something when you know nothing.

quote: Sometimes I feel certain that the hyenas are laughing at us.

quote: If I didn't laugh, absurdity would get the best of me.

quote: Envy expresses itself through condemnation. The louder the condemnation the greater the envy.

quote: More than jealousy or possessiveness pettiness kills love.

quote: A fool who cursed the sun was surprised to see it still shining.

quote: Cruelty is the surest sign of stupidity.

quote: Eternity: the length of a life.

quote: Everything rusts, rots, crumbles, vanishes. The infinite will just take a little bit longer.

quote: I believe in the brief eternity of the rose.

quote: Feelings of superiority always stem from an illusion.

quote: If the light's not in you, you're in the dark.

quote: It's fun to invent systems and meanings and then poke holes in them.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: If loving comes easy, nothing else seems hard.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: I owe my last breath to death but not one breath more.

quote: Rivers are lucky. They can only move in one direction.

quote: Civilization is a scheme to hide nakedness.

quote: Appreciation, not possession, makes a thing ours.

quote: When set out to create order, they create only misery.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Things put in the wrong place have found a new place.

quote: A love that requires constant attention is a doomed love.

quote: Love is not insatiable. What is insatiable is the need for love.

quote: The real blessings come without our asking or even knowing what they are.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Life is simple. You just have to stop trying to figure it out.

quote: The game of love is complicated, but love is not complicated.

quote: If one bite fills you, you don't need two.

quote: My wants are so simple I don't even know what they are.

quote: When an audience shares your prejudices you can always count on their applause.

quote: A poet is someone who never forgets they were born naked.

quote: A poet is a feeling, sentient being, not a word machine.

quote: The only way to live well is to feel intensely.

quote: Life is nothing, if you feel nothing.

quote: A heart that can break is better than no heart at all.

quote: Winter gold: the sparrow's footprints in the snow.

quote: If love is not the answer, what is the question?

quote: What if you have all the pieces and the puzzle still doesn't fit?

quote: A few names have survived oblivion. In time, oblivion will have them all.

quote: Of all the elements in the periodic table, not a single one is indestructible.

quote: I'm on the side of whatever keeps the flowers growing.

quote: I have no heroes except flowers and children.

quote: To speak of happiness is to create happiness.

quote: Nothing is so deceiving as knowledge.

quote: Life itself is the lesson.

quote: Always doubting and questioning everything strikes me as a very miserable way to live.

quote: A breath, to keep one going, must be one's own.

quote: An echo has no voice of its own.

quote: Each moment cancels the last. In the end there is nothing, not even the end.

quote: Sudden revelations vanish just as suddenly.

quote: My calm is like the tides: never at rest.

quote: Being different isn't a sin, but intolerance is.

quote: Hearts are connected by the slenderest of threads.

quote: The familiar is by far the most beautiful.

quote: We're all stumbling in the dark, and that makes for some pretty interesting collisions.

quote: Be unprepared, that's my motto. Be unprepared, and let life overwhelm you.

quote: Accidents are built into the road.

quote: The fenced-in dog barks at the one running free.

quote: If you follow the rules, it's your own fault.

author: Marty Rubin

quote: It never ceases to amaze me: the things people care about.

quote: Boredom is the price one pays for not enjoying everything.

quote: For lack of love one does a million other things.

quote: It doesn't matter what Christ or Buddha said, it matters how they lived.

quote: The fog eventually clears itself.

quote: We reach the end of our lives long before we reach the end of ourselves.

quote: An aphorism needn't be true, but it should sound true.

quote: I love to talk to people who love to talk. The warmth, the energy, the humanity.

quote: Talking to people is the most educational thing I know.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Today is the day you've been waiting for.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Nothing can come of nothing. There is no room in my world for nothing.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: You can always count on God to do nothing.

quote: The most important truths are those which sustain us in our daily lives.

quote: The past lives through us. We are its legacy.

quote: To know oneself means above all to know what one likes

quote: One quick glance in the mirror is enough for a lifetime.
